Package org.roxbotix.elibs2.motor

Interface MotorCore

  • All Superinterfaces:
    LfComponent
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    SharedMotorCore
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Motor, MotorStack, SparkCore, TalonCore
    public interface MotorCore
extends LfComponent
    A simple extension of the LfComponent interface, designed for motors.

    This allows us to simplify motors controlled by both SPARK and Talon motor controllers by simply combining them into one Motor superclass.

    Author:
    Colin Robertson

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      double getPower()
      Get a motor's power.
      void setPower​(double power)
      Set power to a motor.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.roxbotix.elibs2.robot.components.LfComponent

        init

    • Method Detail

      • setPower

        void setPower​(double power)
        Set power to a motor.
        Parameters:
        power - a double, between the values of -1 (negative one) and +1 (positive one). This double, when multiplied by 100, would represent the percentage of power (positive or negative) out of a maximum 100% that the motor will be sent.

      • getPower

        double getPower()
        Get a motor's power.

        Motor power is defined as a double between -1 and +1. -1 represents the fastest the motor can possibly spin - in the backwards direction. On the other hand, +1 represents the fastest the motor can possibly spin - in the forwards direction.

        Returns:
        a double, representing the motor's power.
